lead_paragraph: The court said that a suit against Halliburton and KBR Inc. had been filed too late, and it also expanded the power of bankruptcy judges.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Rules on Whistle-Blower Case and Bankruptcy Judges
headline.main: Supreme Court Rules on Whistle-Blower Case and Bankruptcy Judges

snippet: The court said that a suit against Halliburton and KBR Inc. had been filed too late, and it also expanded the power of bankruptcy judges.
abstract: Supreme Court rules unanimously that whistle-blower lawsuit accusing military contractors KBR Inc and Halliburton Co of fraudulent billing was filed too late; separately, rules 6-3 that bankruptcy judges may hear claims that are ordinarily outside their purview if both parties consent; Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr files sharp dissent in second case, calling it major constitutional misstep.
